definition[0]: all the organs in someone’s body, especially when they have come out of their body
example[0]: There were blood and guts all over the place.
definition[1]: the tube through which food passes from your stomach
example[1]: It can take 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
definition[2]: someone’s stomach, especially when it is large
example[2]: He felt as if someone had just kicked him in the gut.
example[3]: Phil has a huge beer gut  (=unattractive fat stomach caused by drinking too much beer).
definition[3]: a type of strong string made from the intestine of an animal, and used for musical instruments such as violins
definition[4]: to completely destroy the inside of a building, especially by fire
example[4]: The building was gutted by fire.
explanation[0]: Gut is often passive in this meaning
definition[5]: to remove the organs from inside a fish or animal in order to prepare it for cooking
definition[6]: to change something by removing some of the most important or central parts
